findings: 71% of hospitals used predictive AI integrated into EHRs in 2024, up from 66% in 2023
Significant adoption disparities exist between system-affiliated (86%) and independent (37%) hospitals
Large hospitals reached 96% adoption while small hospitals lagged at 59%
Rural hospitals show 56% adoption vs 81% for urban hospitals
Most current AI use remains in administrative domains rather than clinical applications
Hospitals increased evaluation of AI models for accuracy (71%) and bias (57%) in 2024
risks: Digital divide threatens care consistency for vulnerable populations
Potential bias and accuracy concerns with AI implementation
Regulatory and ethical considerations around patient safety and algorithmic fairness
High implementation costs and infrastructure requirements
recommendations: Address adoption disparities between system-affiliated and independent hospitals
Increase focus on clinical applications beyond administrative uses
Strengthen AI governance and evaluation practices across all hospital types
Invest in infrastructure to support rural and critical access hospital adoption
